name: Madesi

aspects.high_concept: Honest Argonian Jeweler in a Den of Thieves
aspects.trouble: Easy Mark for Scams and Thieves
other_aspects: Skilled Craftsman with an Eye for Detail
Dreams of Finding a Rare Gem

stunts: Master Jeweler: +2 to Crafts when creating or repairing jewelry, or appraising gems.
Keen Eye: +2 to Notice when examining gems, jewelry, or detecting fake/stolen goods.
Argonian Kinship: +2 to Rapport when interacting with fellow Argonians or discussing shared hardships.
notes: Madesi is a skilled Argonian jeweler who runs a market stall in Riften's plaza. Despite the city's corruption, he maintains an honest business, crafting fine jewelry and dealing in gems. His pride in his work is matched only by his vulnerability to the thieves and con artists that surround him. Madesi is kind-hearted and somewhat naive about the depths of Riften's criminal underworld, making him an unfortunate target in Brynjolf's recruitment scheme for the Thieves Guild. He dreams of one day obtaining a truly rare gem to craft into a masterpiece. Madesi is friendly with other Argonians in the city, particularly Keerava, and they look out for each other in a city that often treats their kind poorly.

relationships.Keerava: Fellow Argonian and friend - they support each other in Riften
relationships.Brynjolf: Wary of him - has been the victim of his schemes
relationships.Riften Guards: Cordial but knows they won't always help him
relationships.Thieves Guild: Unaware of their full presence but occasionally victimized

quests: A Chance Arrangement (his ring is stolen as part of the Thieves Guild initiation)
Supplier side quest (searching for rare gems)

personality_notes.speaking_style: Polite and professional. Speaks with pride about his craft. Occasionally mentions his Argonian heritage with dignity.
motivations: Create beautiful jewelry and gain recognition for his craft
Find rare gems to work with
Maintain an honest business despite Riften's corruption
Support fellow Argonians in the city
fears: Being robbed or losing his livelihood
Never achieving recognition as a master jeweler
Being unable to compete with dishonest merchants
quirks: Very proud of his jewelry and takes criticism of his work personally
Naive about the extent of crime in Riften
Dreams of crafting a legendary piece
Kind to customers and often gives fair deals
